results.title: The Man in the irony mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Andrew, Kath Shelper and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary portrays the life and death of performance artist and AIDS activist, Brenton Heath-Kerr. Through his repertoire of performances, costumes and photographs, Heath-Kerr challenged perceptions, dominant sterotypes and myths which he thought underpinned the gay communities and notions of gay identity. An emigre of drag and a gender misfit, Heath-Kerr understood that often holding a mask up to society had more political impact than holding up a mirror. (Source: Trove)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Andrew, Kath Shelper and Scarlett Pictures

results.title: Punch (Damon Herriman) puppeteer costume
results.credit_line:
Cutting by Justine Coultham

Construction by Stephanie Van Gastel

Shoes made by Brendan Dwyer

Courtesy Vice Media LLC, Blue-Tongue Films and Pariah Productions
results.material_description: new and repurposed materials, cotton, linen, plastic, polyster, suede, rubber
results.brief_description: Judy and Punch scrounge a living doing puppet shows. To help them stand out from the audience, costume designer Edie Kurzer draped Punch (Damon Herriman) in a bold red costume that contrasted spectacularly with the theatre set where the performances were staged.

constellations_primary.name: Judy and Punch and many more
constellations_primary.description: Women have been oppressed by patriarchal conventions and by men under the guise of the supernatural throughout history, but recent moving-image works are reframing these historical persecutions.

results.description:
In Judy & Punch (2019), the titular characters make a living performing puppet shows. To help the performers stand out from the rest of the crowd, costume designer Edie Kurzer draped Judy (Mia Wasikowska) and Punch (Damon Herriman) in bold red costumes. The production team also recognised that the theatre set was going to have a very different feel to the rest of the town’s locations – lots of candlelight and flickering shadows that saturated the scene in yellow light.

Part of Kurzer’s design process is to involve the actors in fashioning their character’s clothing. Damon Herriman, who plays Punch, said that he wanted to take his jacket off when performing the actual puppeteering, so the shirt beneath was designed to be visually interesting without the jacket.
description_for_label:
In Judy & Punch (2019), the titular characters make a living performing puppet shows. To help the performers stand out from the rest of the crowd, costume designer Edie Kurzer draped Judy (Mia Wasikowska) and Punch (Damon Herriman) in bold red costumes. The production team also recognised that the theatre set was going to have a very different feel to the rest of the town’s locations – lots of candlelight and flickering shadows that saturated the scene in yellow light.

Part of Kurzer’s design process is to involve the actors in fashioning their character’s clothing. Damon Herriman, who plays Punch, said that he wanted to take his jacket off when performing the actual puppeteering, so the shirt beneath was designed to be visually interesting without the jacket.
results.credit_line_for_label:
Cutting by Justine Coultham

Construction by Stephanie Van Gastel

Shoes made by Brendan Dwyer

Courtesy Vice Media LLC, Blue-Tongue Films and Pariah Productions
